keyPolicies.policyDescription: UKIP supports an Australian-style points based system to slash the volume of immigration and end the undercutting of the wages of British working people.
UKIP will increase spending on the NHS by £3bn, funded by ending our EU contributions and will clamp down on so-called 'health tourism'.
UKIP will reduce foreign aid spending from £11bn to £2bn and use the savings to cut taxes for hard-pressed British families.

A UKIP government will prioritise people with local connections in the queue for social housing and implement a ban on non-British nationals exercising the right-to-buy social housing apart from those foreign nationals who have served in the HM Armed Forces.
UKIP will scrap the unjust inheritance tax that hits so many families in Cambridge.

issues.health: UKIP will increase spending on the NHS by £3bn, funded by ending our EU contributions and will clamp down on so-called 'health tourism'.
issues.immigration: UKIP supports an Australian-style points based system to slash the volume of immigration and end the undercutting of the wages of British working people.

housing.content: A UKIP government will prioritise people with local connections in the queue for social housing and implement a ban on non-British nationals exercising the right-to-buy.
